{"id":858850003,"question_id":4,"lang":"python3","lang_name":"Python3","time":"2 years, 2 months","timestamp":1670881907,"status":10,"status_display":"Accepted","runtime":"217 ms","url":"/submissions/detail/858850003/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"14.2 MB","code":"class Solution:\n    def findMedianSortedArrays(self, nums1: List[int], nums2: List[int]) -> float:\n        A,B=nums1,nums2\n        total=len(nums1)+len(nums2)\n        half=total//2\n\n        if len(B)<len(A):\n            A,B=B,A\n\n        l,r=0,len(A)-1\n\n        while True:\n            i=(l+r)//2\n            j=(half-i-2)\n\n            Aleft=A[i] if i>=0 else float(\"-infinity\")\n            Aright=A[i+1] if (i+1)<len(A) else float(\"infinity\")\n            Bleft=B[j] if j>=0 else float(\"-infinity\")\n            Bright=B[j+1] if (j+1)<len(B) else float(\"infinity\")\n\n            if Aleft<=Bright and Bleft<=Aright:\n                if total%2:\n                    return min(Aright,Bright)\n                return (max(Aleft,Bleft)+min(Aright,Bright))/2\n            elif Aleft>Bright:\n                r=i-1\n            else:\n                l=i+1","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
